qas.question: How does the Cambridge English Dictionary define "Culture" in short?
What is the name of this theory that culture is a series of activities and world views?
What did Homo Sapiens acquire that allowed them to become aware of Culture?
How does the Cambridge Swedish Dictionary define "Culture" in short?
What is the name of a theory that culture is a series of locations and world rules?
What did Homo Sapiens acquire that allowed them to become unaware of Culture?

plausible_answers.text: "the way of life, especially the general customs and beliefs, of a particular group of people at a particular time."

qas.question: What are Homo Sapiens able to avoid as  a result of having a larger brain?
What is defined as "the way of life, especially the supernatural customs and beliefs, of a particular individual at a particular time?"

context: Cambridge English Dictionary states that <b7_0>culture<b7_0/> is, <b6_0>"<a0_0><b3_0>the way of life<b3_0/><a0_0/>, especially the general customs and beliefs, of a particular group of people at a particular time."<b6_0/> <a1_0><b4_0>Terror Management Theory<b4_0/><a1_0/> posits that culture is a series of activities and worldviews that provide humans with the illusion of being individuals of value in a world meaning—raising themselves above the merely physical aspects of existence, in order to deny the animal insignificance and death that Homo Sapiens became aware of when they acquired a <a2_0><b5_0>larger brain<b5_0/><a2_0/>.
